source.title: Why Vitest | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Rationale for Vitest as a Vite-native test runner: unified configuration pipeline, instant HMR, Jest-compatible API, parallel execution via Worker threads, lightweight dependencies, performance improvements, and watch mode enabled by default.

source.title: Getting Started | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Installation, basic test writing with expect API, configuration via vite.config or vitest.config, projects support, CLI usage, IDE integrations, dependency management, examples, and community resources.

source.title: Configuring Vitest | Vitest
source.description: Configuration reference: test property options, file patterns, server settings, execution modes, environments, reporters, coverage, mocking, benchmarking, browser mode, workspace projects, and all parameters with types and defaults.

source.title: Features | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Core features including Vite integration, smart watch mode, TypeScript support, concurrent execution, snapshots, Jest-compatible assertions, Tinyspy mocking, DOM environments, code coverage via v8/istanbul, in-source testing, benchmarking, type testing, and sharding

source.title: Component Testing | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Component testing with isolation and integration strategies, Testing Library integration via page.elementLocator, MSW for API mocking, async patterns, form validation, error boundaries, accessibility testing, browser debugging, Jest migration guide.

source.title: Why Browser Mode | Browser Mode | Vitest
source.description: Browser mode rationale comparing jsdom and happy-dom simulation limitations versus native browser accuracy, false positive risks, trade-offs including longer initialisation and early development status, recommended augmentation with standalone test runners.

source.title: Browser Mode | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Browser Mode installation with Playwright, WebdriverIO, or Preview providers, configuration for React, Vue, Svelte, headless execution, viewport options, component rendering, DOM assertions, interactivity API, limitations with dialogs and module spying.

source.title: Vitest UI | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Optional Vitest UI for viewing and interacting with tests, installation via @vitest/ui package, launching with --ui flag, HTML reporter configuration, static report generation, coverage integration, output file options.

source.title: Test Environment | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Environment configuration options (node, jsdom, happy-dom, edge-runtime), per-file environment selection via @vitest-environment control comments, custom environment package creation with setup/setupVM lifecycle methods, viteEnvironment requirement, and populateGlobal utility function.

source.title: Mocking | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Mocking cheat sheet using vi helper: vi.mock and vi.spyOn for functions, classes, exported variables, partial modules, factory caching patterns, vi.setSystemTime for dates, vi.stubGlobal and vi.stubEnv for globals, browser mode limitations.

source.title: Testing Types | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Type testing using expectTypeOf and assertType APIs, test-d.ts file conventions, typecheck.include configuration, tsc/vue-tsc integration, error message interpretation for type mismatches, ts-expect-error patterns, and --typecheck CLI flag setup.

source.title: In-Source Testing | Guide | Vitest
source.description: In-source testing using import.meta.vitest blocks, includeSource configuration, production build dead code elimination via define options for bundlers (Vite, Rolldown, Rollup, unbuild, webpack), TypeScript support.

source.title: Extending Matchers | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Custom matcher creation using expect.extend, TypeScript interface extensions, matcher function structure with pass and message returns, context properties (isNot, promise, equals, utils), and async matcher implementation patterns.

source.title: Reporters | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Built-in reporters (default, verbose, tree, dot, junit, json, html, tap, tap-flat, hanging-process, github-actions, blob) with configuration options, outputFile setup, combining multiple reporters, custom reporter implementation via Reporter interface.

source.title: Command Line Interface | Guide | Vitest
source.description: CLI commands (vitest, run, watch, related, bench, init, list) and comprehensive options including coverage configuration, browser settings, test filtering, watch mode, sharding, reporters, changed file detection, and merge-reports functionality.

source.title: Improving Performance | Vitest
source.description: Test isolation settings with isolate and fileParallelism options, pool configurations (threads, forks, vmThreads), directory search limiting, and test sharding for parallel execution across multiple machines using shard and merge-reports commands.

source.title: allowOnly | Config | Vitest
source.description: Configuration option controlling whether tests marked with only flag are permitted, with default behaviour blocking them in CI environments but allowing them locally, configurable via allowOnly setting or CLI flag.
